medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms began 3 days prior to presentation, described as constant and dull with intermittent sharp pain in the right lower quadrant (RLQ). The patient has never experienced such pain before. Denies fevers, chills, nausea, or vomiting.
medical_history.past_medical_history: History of sigmoid colon cancer status post low anterior resection, coronary artery disease status post 3-vessel CABG, chronic renal insufficiency, osteoarthritis, type 2 diabetes mellitus, hypertension, hearing aid use, cataracts, and prior hernia surgery.
